children.subject: You really don't need to take 54, since 16 series is meant to teach all the same material anyway but in a less rigorous manner. You should potentially just re-study the linear algebra you don't understand from 16A and then give 16B another go. Attend all the discussion sections and OH. This will save you 4 precious units that you would otherwise have to complete with 54. Try to power through the undergrad reqs because they are weeders.
Yes, he did! He mentioned this in our last lecture on Thursday.

So, did Prof. Paulin really mentioned that he would be teaching 54 in Spring 2022?
Not deliberately shifting the topic but that’s a fascinating news to me.

history.content:
<md>Take Math 54 in the Fall (with Nadler) and then you will find the linear algebra portions of EECS16b much more manageable, as well as parts of the differntial equations. 

I thought linear algebra was taught much better in Math 54 than in EECS16a.</md>

So I'm a freshman who took 16a Fall 2020 and then 16b Spring 2021. I late dropped 16b because the linear algebra part was too much for me, so I decided that I should take math 54 to help with 16b. I plan on taking 16b Spring 2022. 

So, I also have to take Math 53 next year. Should I take Math 53 Fall 2021 and then Math 54 Spring 2022 alongside 16b? The reason I don't want to take Math 54 Fall 2021 is because Prof. Paulin is teaching Math 54 Spring 2022, but I think taking Math 54 in Fall 2021 might be beneficial?

For those who took both Math 54 and EECS16b, what are your thoughts? Was it really beneficial to take it before 16b or would it be fine if I took Math 54 the same semester as 16b? What parts of Math 54 were beneficial for 16b?
history.subject: Should I take Math 54 before EECS16b or concurrently with EECS16b?
